channel.title: Explanation of Common Exceptions
channel.description:
[center][b][size=14pt]Common Java Exceptions![/size][/b][/center]
Well, since half of you don't know what any of the exceptions your server throws mean, I have decided to create a thread dedicated to telling you what some Java exceptions mean. Exceptions are sorted by the package to which they apply. [hr] [b][size=12pt]java.lang[/size][/b] [b]ClassCastException[/b] - Occurs when you try to cast an object to a class which is not it's subclass, sub interface, or class. Example: [code]RsObject rsObject = new RsObject(); WowObject wowObject = (WowObject) rsObject; // This line would throw a ClassCastException as rsObject is not a WowObject.[/code] [b]ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException[/b] - Thrown when you try to access an index on an array which doesn't exist. Example: [code]Object[] array = new Object[200]; Object obj = array[200]; // Would throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException as the array indices start at 0 meaning max is 199.[/code] [b]NullPointerException[/b] - Thrown when you try to use an object reference who's value is null. Example:[code]Object object = null; object.notify(); // Would throw NullPointerException as the object to which object points is null.[/code] [hr] [b][size=12pt]java.util[/size][/b] [b]ConcurrentModificationException[/b] - Thrown when multiple threads try to read/modify an object at the same time. Multiple threads can read at the same time but multiple threads can't write at the same time, or read and write at the same time. [hr] [b][size=12pt]java.io[/size][/b] [b]FileNotFoundException[/b] - Gets thrown when you try to load a file that doesn't exist. [b]IOException[/b] - Thrown when an errors occurs with Input/Output, this may be a reading or writing to a stream or channel problem. [b]NotSerializableException[/b] - Thrown when you try to serialize an object that doesn't implement Serializable.
Well that's all I can think of right now, if there are any you would like me to add just request it and I'd be happy to.

@the_soul wrote:

I was in conflict with myself thinking whether to sticky this due to the excessive amount already or not but since the common compiling errors thread is this should be too. If you don’t mind adding some of the more common ones (i.e NullPointerException) then that would be great.

EDIT: would someone care to make one thread including all of common compiling errors and runtime exceptions?

Read full topic

item.title: Explanation of Common Exceptions
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[center][size=14pt]Common Java Exceptions![/size][/center]

Well, since half of you don’t know what any of the exceptions your server throws mean, I have decided to create a thread dedicated to telling you what some Java exceptions mean. Exceptions are sorted by the package to which they apply.
[hr]
[size=12pt]java.lang[/size]
ClassCastException - Occurs when you try to cast an object to a class which is not it’s subclass, sub interface, or class.
Example: RsObject rsObject = new RsObject(); WowObject wowObject = (WowObject) rsObject; // This line would throw a ClassCastException as rsObject is not a WowObject.
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown when you try to access an index on an array which doesn’t exist.
Example: Object[] array = new Object[200]; Object obj = array[200]; // Would throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException as the array indices start at 0 meaning max is 199.
NullPointerException - Thrown when you try to use an object reference who’s value is null.
Example:Object object = null; object.notify(); // Would throw NullPointerException as the object to which object points is null.
[hr]
[size=12pt]java.util[/size]
ConcurrentModificationException - Thrown when multiple threads try to read/modify an object at the same time. Multiple threads can read at the same time but multiple threads can’t write at the same time, or read and write at the same time.
[hr]
[size=12pt]java.io[/size]
FileNotFoundException - Gets thrown when you try to load a file that doesn’t exist.
IOException - Thrown when an errors occurs with Input/Output, this may be a reading or writing to a stream or channel problem.
NotSerializableException - Thrown when you try to serialize an object that doesn’t implement Serializable.

Well that’s all I can think of right now, if there are any you would like me to add just request it and I’d be happy to.

Read full topic
